sourcing.instructions: P (Phosphorus) - Chemical supply stores; Ru (Ruthenium) - Precious metal suppliers; Sc (Scandium) - Specialty metal vendors; Y (Yttrium) - Rare earth material suppliers.
steps: P (Phosphorus) - Chemical supply stores; Ru (Ruthenium) - Precious metal suppliers; Sc (Scandium) - Specialty metal vendors; Y (Yttrium) - Rare earth material suppliers.

1. Weigh out 18.0 g of Phosphorus, 85.5 g of Ruthenium, 1.0 g of Scandium, and 20.0 g of Yttrium using a precision balance. 2. Combine the weighed ingredients in a clean, dry ceramic or glass mixing container. 3. Mix thoroughly using a ceramic spatula to ensure a uniform blend of powders.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 18.0 g of Phosphorus, 85.5 g of Ruthenium, 1.0 g of Scandium, and 20.0 g of Yttrium using a precision balance. 2. Combine the weighed ingredients in a clean, dry ceramic or glass mixing container. 3. Mix thoroughly using a ceramic spatula to ensure a uniform blend of powders.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a high-density graphite crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace and heat to 1,200째C at a rate of 10째C per minute. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of the desired compound.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a high-density graphite crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace and heat to 1,200째C at a rate of 10째C per minute. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of the desired compound.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool down to room temperature naturally, which may take approximately 6-8 hours. Do not force cool to avoid cracking.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool down to room temperature naturally, which may take approximately 6-8 hours. Do not force cool to avoid cracking.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use sandpaper (grade 400) to smoothen the edges and surface of the sample. 3. Optionally, apply a thin layer of protective sealant to enhance durability and finish.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use sandpaper (grade 400) to smoothen the edges and surface of the sample. 3. Optionally, apply a thin layer of protective sealant to enhance durability and finish.
